p: A recently introduced species into Australia [ 64, 65], Cx. gelidus, is also a highly efficient laboratory vector of WNV NY-99 [ 46], as it is for a range of JEV serological group viruses, including WNV KUN and JEV [ 66]. Whilst there is potential for this species to spread [ 67], Cx. gelidus does not currently share the wide geographical distribution of Cx. annulirostris or Cx. quinquefasciatus, being restricted mostly to focal regions in northern Australia and usually at low densities. Further, Cx. gelidus is largely mammalophilic [ 54, 68] which may reduce its potential role in urban enzootic transmission of WNV. Nonetheless, the establishment of Cx. gelidus in Australia clearly demonstrates the potential impact of exotic mosquito species on the transmission cycles of both exotic and endemic arboviruses.
